item.title: Problem Sum Root to Leaf Numbers
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 129 Question You are given the root of a binary tree containing digits from 0 to 9 only. Each root-to-leaf path in the tree represents a number. For example, the root-to-leaf path 1 -> 2 -> 3 represents the number 123. Return the total sum of all root-to-leaf numbers. Test cases are generated so that the answer will fit in a 32-bit integer. A leaf node is a node with no children.

item.title: RaspberryPi_Zero_Setup
item.description: Raspberry Pi Zero Headless WiFi Setup Using Linux The following instructions will ultimately enable your Pi Zero to connect the WiFi to the router during every boot up, for a headless management. Appendix Prerequisite Enabling USB ethernet gadget mode on Pi Things to do once connected to Pi via USB 3.1. Enabling Internet access in Raspberry Pi 3.2. SSH into Raspberry Pi 3.3. Change locale settings 3.4. Update the OS 3.

item.title: About
item.description: This is the about section of my blog. Here, I will provide information about myself and the purpose of this blog. I am a passionate software developer with a keen interest in web development and data science. Through this blog, I aim to share my knowledge, experiences, and insights with fellow developers and enthusiasts. Topics that I plan to cover in this blog include programming tutorials, tips and tricks, project showcases, and discussions on the latest trends in the tech industry.
